== Who I Am ==
I am Vinicius Peixoto, a software engineer from Brazil, currently a member of the Kernel Team at Canonical and working on various cloud kernels. I am also a Computer Engineering graduate from the State University of Campinas, Brazil.

== My Ubuntu Story ==
Ubuntu was my first distro and my de facto introduction to the Linux world. I started using it fully as a daily driver back in 2018 and have never stopped since then. Although I've explored many distros on my personal machines, I have always run Ubuntu or Debian on my servers.

I have also helped run several Linux Install Fest events as a member of LKCAMP, a FOSS study group from my university, where I have helped install Linux (mostly Ubuntu) on the machines of students and other people interested in giving Linux a try. 

=== My Involvement ===
During my time at Canonical, I have worked on preparing several kernel updates for the SRU cycle (mostly for Azure and IBM kernels). I have also prepared feature/CVE backports for several cloud kernels, getting patches through the SRU review process. I have also worked on mailing list reviews and Launchpad bug triage duty. More recently, I have also helped prepare some of the kernel updates for Ubuntu Asahi (the Ubuntu port for M1/M2 Apple systems).

=== Philip Cox (philcox) ===
==== General feedback ====

==== Specific Experiences of working together ====
I have worked with Vinicius extensively since he started working at Canonical.  I have not sponsored many of his kernels he has produced, but I have reviewed a handful of them and provided guidance to him.  He took care of a few of my kernels while I was on PTO, and handled their cranking, and the follow on of their testing until I returned.  He managed these kernels fine even tough they were not totally straight-forward as one was repairing a build break.

I have also worked very closely with him during the bug triage rotations, as well as the bug triage during the winter SRU shutdown this past year, and I have worked along side of him on various cloud related issues.

He is very diligent, and has been able to pick things up quickly.  He has shown good judgement, and understands when to ask for help or guidance.  He also demonstrated good follow-through and has worked on resolving bug of the bugs that were fairly challenging.  

I don't have any hesitations on endorsing him for his kernel upload rights.
